conclusion: An ideal gas of a definite quality undergoes the ABCDA cycle as shown in the figure, where P1, P2, V1, and V2 are known quantities. It is given that the temperature at state A is T0.

The image shows a thermodynamic cycle labeled ABCDA on a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram. The cycle involves two horizontal and two vertical line segments. The points are labeled A, B, C, and D, with horizontal segments connecting A to B and C to D, and vertical segments connecting B to C and D to A. The diagram includes pressure (p) and volume (V) axes, with lines indicating pressure levels p1 and p2, and volume levels V1 and V2. The temperature at State A is given as T0.

premise: The cycle ABCDA is a thermodynamic process involving an ideal gas. Since the gas is of definite quality, it undergoes a cyclic process, meaning ΔU = 0.
conclusion: For an ideal gas, the internal energy U is a function of temperature only, so ΔU = nCVΔT = 0. This implies the temperature at the end of the cycle is the same as the initial temperature.

premise: The temperature at the end of the cycle is the same as the initial temperature.
